clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Efficacy of Intense Pulse Light Combined With Lipiflow in the Treatment of Meibomian Gland Dysfunction
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Efficacy of Intense Pulse Light Combined With Lipiflow in the Treatment of Meibomian Gland Dysfunction

lead_sponsor.agency: Aier School of Ophthalmology, Central South University

clinical_study.source: Aier School of Ophthalmology, Central South University

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the effect of IPL combined with lipiflow and IPL combined with meibomian gland massage in treating meibomian gland dysfunction of different degrees ,focusing on effective rate, lasting time and changes of meibomian gland function and morphology.

detailed_description.textblock: To divide all participants into two groups, group one treated with IPL combined with Lipiflow and group two treated with IPL combined with meibomian gland massage.The following parameters were recorded after treatment: the effective rate, lasting time and changes of meibomian gland function and morphology.All parameters were compared between the two groups.

primary_outcome.description: The OSDI is assessed on a scale of 0 to 100,with higher scores representing greater disability

primary_outcome.measure: meibomian gland expressibility score and meibum quality score
primary_outcome.description: The score is on a scale of 0 to 6.The higher scores, the severity of the meibomian gland function(the highest score is 6 and the lowest score is 0)
the higher scores, the severity of the meibomian gland morphology(The highest score is 6 and the lowest score is 0)
the shorter time, the poorer of the tear film stability

arm_group.description: the group in which patients treated with IPL combined with lipiflow
the group in which patients treated with IPL combined with meibomian gland massage

intervention.description: To treat patients with MGD using intense pulsed light combined with lipiflow
To treat patients with MGD using intense pulsed light combined with meibomian gland massage

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with meibomian gland dysfunction
- patients with ocular discomfort
- skin type:FitzpatricⅠ-Ⅳ
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with acute ocular inflammation
- eye surgery history in the last 12 months
- patients who have received IPL or Lipiflow in the last 12 months
- patients who wear contact lens in last one month
